OTIS McALLISTER CO., LTD.
GREEN COFFEE BROKERS
New Orleans. June 21 st
Dear Sid [and] Fuhrer--
Hi ! How are the Happy Families coming along-- any
throats been cut yet ? I sure would like to see thatm household in
operation. Perhaps I'll have the chance as I may have to come to New
York sometime this summer to arrange banking credit for my new firm.
Sure was sorry to hear about your sacroiliac Sid and trust it
is fixed up by now-if not , be sure and come down here and let my
buddy Ruffian Walton work on you. I hope nothing inteferes with your
plans of coming down here the early part of July after you finish the 
sightseeing trip to the Fuhrers movies. Incidentally , Morris, when
Olive and I drove here from Kafrums graduation we went by way of Landis
and Kannapolis so that I could show her those fine Movie houses. We
tried to spend the night in Kannapolis so that we could attend the
movie [ free of course! ] but thats a mighty inhospitable town as they
dont have a hotel or a tourist camp or anything. Guess Ole Man Cannon
just dont like strangers!
Olive is all set for you whenver you want to come. Just give
us a few days warning so that we can put the gumbo pot on to boil.
Beulah is in the hospital at present with a tumor but we have another
"jewel" named Lily who worked about thirty years for Dr Jeff Miller
and she claims to be the Worlds Champ at Gumbo. We will see ! The
hickea is all in place on the downstaris porch and in fact I have been
sleeping on it recently while waiting for the air-conditioning units
upstairs to get repaired. There is plenty of room on it for all three
of us to sleep-- women included! Also the crab and shrimp season is
just right now and plenty good food to be had at the lakefront. Fif 
and May are due back here Monday so Olive and I are planning to take
them and our offspring to the Lakefron Monday night and get full of
beer and shrimp while hearing from them all the latest news re the
Biddles and you.
Many thanks Sid for your letter of June 14 wishing me Happy
Birthday and also thank you Fuhrer for your wire of congratulations.
Incidentally you will be glad to know that this year I celebrated it
considerably quieter than last year when you were here and my colored
buddy Moody and I got pie-eyed . This year I was right in the midst
of some horse-trading with my boss over the new firm and I couldnt
afford to get drunk. In fact we finally closed the deal on my birthday.
I got just about everything I could possibly expect out of
him--in fact a lot more than I ever thought I would. We intend to
start the new Corporation on August 1 st. We will incorporate for
$100,000 but will only put up half this at the start and the balance
will be put up at some later date provided it is needed. Since I am
a 50[percent] owner , I will only need $25,000 on August 1 st. Sid , you said
you had this amount available now so you can turn it over to me an time
convenient to you between now and August 1 st. How about doing it when
you come down here in July ? We could then draw up the necessary notes
[Stationary footer]
[End Page 1]
[Stationary heading]
OTIS McALLISTER CO., LETD.
GREEN COFFEE BROKERS
and I will arrange some kind of collateral, either life insurance or
mortagage on my house or whatever you prefer. I myself would rather
take out a new life insurance policy in your favor so as not to disturb
my present life insurance plan in favor of Olive and the children.
However in the event I'm not able to pass a medical exam for new life
insurance , I can transfer some of my present policies to you as have
a total of around $80,000 with a present cash surrender value of about
$20,000. I dont want to apply right now for a new policy as am still
going to the Doc about my amoebas. He expect to have a vaccine ready
in the next week that has been made from a culture of my crap and he
hopes it will fix me up, So I want to wait on that so that when I apply
for a life insurance policy I can show a letter from the Doc saying that
I'm cured. By the time you get here in July I hope this will all be
straightened out.
Enclosed is copy of letter I have written Johnson-- Ye Boss.
From it you will note that I'm having our lawyers draw up various
papers covering Articles of Incorporation etc. These should be ready
in a few days and I'll send you a copy if you like.
You will also note that I have hired a financial man. I had
hoped to get Cummings who also used to be with me at Zander and who is
the one that you and I talked to Sid when you were here in April and he
is the one Morris that sent you the bill for $15 last year but you
thought it was for $150 ! He was all set to come with me at $8,000.
salary plus bonus but when he went to his present employers they made
him a n offer of $8,000 plus bonus and in addition made him manager of
their New Orleans office. I couldnt top that , so he is staying there
and instead I have gotten-another of my previous Zander "boys" , Martin
Doody to come. He isnt as good as Cummings but he is okay and I think
he will develop. I think we now have a pretty good little organization.
I figure our yearly overhead should come to about $50,000 at
the most. My arrangement for the new firm is that we receive 25 ¢ per
bag on all coffees sold by the Otis organizations in our "Southern"
territory. In the past twelve months, even though we were xxxxxxx
hampered by OPA restriction up to Oct 17 th 1946, and by being a new
firm here , we sold over 150,000 bags in this Southern territory. At
25 ¢ a bag that would have figured $7,500. I surely think we can this
well or better this coming year, so that this brokerage alone will just
about cover our overhead. In addition, the new firm has the right to
sell its own coffee anywhere in the USA---not just in the Southern part--
with a few restrictions. These restrictions are not bad at all and they
were the things that I was arguing with Johnson about and I think I got
my way about 99 [percent]. So, we should surely be able to make money on the
coffees owned by the New Orleans firm, and of course I have free rein
to buy my coffees from anyone I want, to sell "options" on the New York
Coffee Exchange, take any "position" I want etc etc.
The only drawback to the entire thing of course is that I
have Johnson as a 50 $ partner but I am Pres and Gen Manager and he has
[Stationary footer]
[End Page 2]
[Stationary heading]
OTIS McALLISTER CO., LTD.
GREEN COFFEE BROKERS
Page 3
promised not to bother me until we have completed a years business.
If we dont show a profit then he has the right to raise all the Merry
Hell he wants.' If we find out that we cant get along with each
other we will part company after year or so and with this in mind
I'm having the lawyers draw up an agreement saying just how we will
do this , so that when the time comes xxxxxx we will have a basis to
buy or sell on. Also in case of his death or mine, our heirs will be
protected.
Meantime , this arrangement gives me the safest way that I can
think of for once again actually running my own business. I'll be
doing everything that I would if I had instead gone into biz for
myself alone, and I have the very great advantage of having all the
Otis McAllister coffees here inNew Orleans at my disposal to sell on
a 25 ¢ per bag broker ge with absolutely no risk on my part.
All in all, there is no doubt that the advantages in the deal
far offset the disadvantage of having him as a 50[percent] partner. After a few 
years, after I have gotten well entrenched, there is nothing to stop
me from pulling out and starting my own concern and by then I think
that I can take with me some of our accounts in Brazil etc. When that
time comes then I'll need more money to finance with as am sure my own
name wont get as big a crdit line with the banks as the Otis name does.
They get about ten to one-- that is for every $100,000 of their net
worth, the banks give them a line of credit for a million bucks. On my
own name I would be lucky to get 4 to 1-- it would probably be 3 to 1.
That is why we will only be putting up a total of $50,000 on August l st
because with Johnson[ same as Otis McAllister] associated with the new
firm, the banks will probably give us a half million line of credit
which should be more than enough at least for the first year or so.
When the time comes that I think it wise to pull out for myself
and I need more dough, I will come yelplng to both of you per my usual
custom, but let us hope that in the meantime I will have made some
dough out of this present arrangement andHAVE SAVED IT , and wont have
to nick you two for too dam much! Needless to say I sure do thank you
both for all you have done so far, as without the knowledge that you
were willing to back me I could not have afforded to get as "tough" as
I have with Johnson. With your help I have been able to beat him at
this little game of Poker-- at least I THINK I have---mebbe the future
will prove otherwise but I think not. So long guys, sure am looking
forward to your visit so dont dlssapoint us 
Arma Arma
[Stationary footer]
